intro: Myrsine bottensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myrsine, is a tropical shrub native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries. Myrsine bottensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within coastal forests.
